===Etymology===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Lacquer}}
[[File:Wajimanurie.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|漆}} (''urushi''): a traditional red '''[[lacquer]]'''ware serving set.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うるし}}
Appears to be derived from {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=うるし}} root ''uru'', as in terms such as classical Japanese {{m|ja|潤う|tr=urufu}} → modern {{m|ja|潤う|tr=uruou||to be moist}}, {{m|ja|うるうる|tr=uruuru||wetly, moistly|pos=adverb}}. Probably from the way that a lacquered surface [[glisten]]s as if [[wet]].
